summary: A letter from Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss to the Metropolitan Detention Center's legal department, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the inmate to whom discovery materials are being transmitted.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell at the detention center.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
MDCâ€”Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is dated October 2, 2020, during the pre-trial phase of Ghislaine Maxwell's federal criminal case.
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn under inmate number 02879-509.
The letter serves as official correspondence transmitting discovery materials from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the defendant.
Audrey Strauss was serving as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at this time.
The case is identified as United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
